forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 42. Northwest wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.shortForecast: Mostly Sunny then Chance Light Rain
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 4pm. Mostly sunny. High near 54, with temperatures falling to around 51 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 5 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening falls over Downtown San Francisco, an air of tranquility cloaks the city, accompanied by a gentle chill that lingers around 42 degrees. The northern skies, scattered with the remnants of clouds, offer a faint glimmer of stars peeking through the gradient of twilight. A northwest breeze whispers softly at six miles per hour, encouraging those wrapped in light layers to saunter along the waterfront, where the fragrant air mingles with the salty embrace of the bay.

Looking ahead to Tuesday, the promise of a mostly sunny morning gives way to a dance of clouds by afternoon, with disquieting whispers of rain arriving post-4 PM. A high of 54 may comfort those craving a respite from the chill, yet temperatures are poised to retreat slightly as the day progresses, adding a layer of complexity to one’s outfit. Those who venture out may find the day pleasant, with a chance of rain looming—a gentle reminder to bring along a light jacket and perhaps an umbrella, though nothing too bulky, as the clouds may just flirt with the concept of precipitation. A stroll through the city’s parks or a quiet visit to a local café could spark contentment, as the urban landscape recharges in anticipation of what lies ahead.
